steps.title: Try uninstalling Minecraft like you would other Windows programs.
steps.content: Try uninstalling Minecraft like you would other Windows programs. The newest versions of Minecraft can use a traditional Windows installer, which adds Minecraft to the list of programs you can uninstall through the Control Panel: [3] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source Click the Start menu and select "Control Panel". Windows 8 users can open the Charms menu, select "Settings" and then "Control Panel". Select "Uninstall a program" or "Programs and Features". This will load a list of programs that are installed on your computer. The list may take a few moments to load. Select Minecraft in the list. If Minecraft is not listed here, move on to the next step. Click Uninstall and follow the prompts to completely uninstall Minecraft.

steps.title: Press .
steps.content: Press . ⊞ Win + R to open the Run box. You can also click the Start menu and select "Run".

steps.title: Type .
steps.content: Type . %appdata% and press ↵ Enter . This will open the Roaming folder.

steps.title: Drag the .
steps.content: Drag the . .minecraft folder to the Recycle Bin. You can also right-click it and select "Delete". This will completely uninstall Minecraft.

steps.title: Backup your saved games (optional).
steps.content: Backup your saved games (optional). You can keep your saved worlds if you plan on reinstalling Minecraft later. [5] X Research source Open your file manager and navigate to /home/ username /.minecraft, replacing username with your Linux username. Copy the saves folder to another location. When you reinstall Minecraft, you can copy the folder back.

steps.title: Open the Terminal
steps.content: Open the Terminal . In Ubuntu, you can quickly access the Terminal by pressing Ctrl + Alt + T .

steps.title: Type .
steps.content: Type . rm -vr ~/.minecraft/* and press ↵ Enter . You may be prompted to enter your administrator password. This command will delete all of the Minecraft files on your computer.

steps.title: Backup
steps.content: Backup your saved games (optional). Before you uninstall Minecraft PE, you can back up your saved games. For Apple devices, this requires a computer if your device is not jailbroken. You can skip this step if you just want to uninstall the game. [6] X Research source Download and install iExplorer. You can get the free version from macroplant.com/iexplorer/ . If you're using Windows, you'll also need iTunes installed. Connect your device to your computer using the USB cable. Unlock the phone if it has a PIN lock. Expand your device, and then expand the "Apps" section. Expand "Minecraft PE" → "Documents" → "games" → "com.mojang". Copy the MinecraftWorlds folder to another location. When you reinstall Minecraft PE, you can copy the folder back.

steps.title: Press and hold the Minecraft PE icon until all of the icons start wiggling.
steps.content: Press and hold the Minecraft PE icon until all of the icons start wiggling.

steps.title: Tap the "X" on the Minecraft PE icon to uninstall Minecraft.
steps.content: Tap the "X" on the Minecraft PE icon to uninstall Minecraft.

steps.title: Backup your saved games (optional).
steps.content: Backup your saved games (optional). Before you uninstall Minecraft PE, you can back up your saved games. [7] X Research source Open your Android's file system by using either a File Manager app (such as ES File Explorer) or by connecting your device to a computer. Open the games folder and then the com.mojang folder. Copy the MinecraftWorlds folder to another location. When you reinstall Minecraft PE, you can copy the folder back.

steps.title: Open the Settings app on your device.
steps.content: Open the Settings app on your device.

steps.title: Select "Apps" or "Applications".
steps.content: Select "Apps" or "Applications".

steps.title: Find "Minecraft Pocket Edition" in the list of Downloaded apps.
steps.content: Find "Minecraft Pocket Edition" in the list of Downloaded apps.

steps.title: Tap the "Uninstall" button.
steps.content: Tap the "Uninstall" button. You will be asked to confirm that you want to completely remove Minecraft PE. If you are a beginner, you can try the game before buying it.
